summary: A val-statement declares a new readonly local variable.
details: The value stored in the variable will be reassigned, if the val-statement is executed again.
The scope of the assignee is anywhere in the enclosing function.
The assignee is alive precisely during an activation of the enclosing function.
The type of the newly declared variable is the type of the value.
In other words, the type of the variable is inferred.
static-checks: The assignee cannot share its name with another variable declared in the same scope.
The type of the value must be a variable-type.
example-1: module Main in examples;%0A%0A@Start%0Adefun main (args : String[]) : void%0A{%0A    # Create a boolean variable.%0A    val a = true;%0A%0A    # Create a char variable.%0A    val b = 'A';%0A%0A    # Create a byte variable.%0A    val c = 11B;%0A%0A    # Create a short variable.%0A    val d = 13S;%0A%0A    # Create a int variable.%0A    val e = 17;%0A%0A    # Create a long variable.%0A    val f = 19L;%0A%0A    # Create a float variable.%0A    val g = 23.0F;%0A%0A    # Create a double variable.%0A    val h = 27.0;%0A%0A    # Create a string variable.%0A    val i = %22Venus%22;%0A%0A    # Create a list variable.%0A    val j = [%22Jupiter%22, %22Saturn%22, %22Uranus%22, %22Neptune%22];%0A%0A    # Create another int variable.%0A    val x = e + 3;%0A%0A    # Create yet another int variable.%0A    val y = x + e;%0A%0A    # Create a list containing the values of the previous variables.%0A    val values = [a, b, c, d, e, f, g, i, j, x, y];%0A%0A    foreach (value : Object in values)%0A    {%0A        F::print(%22Value = %22);%0A        F::println(value);%0A    }%0A}
Value = true%0AValue = A%0AValue = 11%0AValue = 13%0AValue = 17%0AValue = 19%0AValue = 23.0%0AValue = Venus%0AValue = [Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune]%0AValue = 20%0AValue = 37
example-2: module Main in examples;%0A%0A@Start%0Adefun main (args : String[]) : void%0A{%0A    # Variable square can only be assigned to at its declaration site.%0A    # In other words, variable square is readonly. %0A    # However, the declaration site may be executed multiple times. %0A    # The value of the variable may be updated each time. %0A%0A    for (i = 1; i < 5; i + 1)%0A    {%0A        val square = i * i;%0A%0A        F::println (square);%0A    }%0A}
